title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA (AP) — On a night where the rim must have seemed as wide as the ocean, Steve Smith put on a performance for the ages, single-handedly carrying the Atlanta Hawks to a gritty 93-88 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

In a defensive struggle, Smith was the undeniable force of nature, pouring in a game-high 46 points. The Cavaliers, led by a balanced effort with Shawn Kemp (16 points) and Danny Ferry (15 points), simply had no answer for the Atlanta guard’s offensive onslaught. Every time Cleveland threatened to close the gap, Smith had a response, his shooting stroke a study in pure, unadulterated brilliance.

While Smith’s scoring was historic, the Hawks’ supporting cast provided the necessary grit. Dikembe Mutombo, the league’s premier defender, anchored the paint with a formidable 18-rebound, 5-block performance, stifling Cleveland’s attempts to attack the basket and ensuring Smith’s heroics were not in vain.

The Cavaliers fought valiantly, with Terrell Brandon dishing out 9 assists and controlling the tempo, but they lacked that one transcendent scorer to match Smith’s epic night. In the end, they were witnesses to a masterpiece.

This was more than just a win; it was a statement etched in the record books by one man’s unforgettable will. On this night in Atlanta, Steve Smith wasn't just a basketball player; he was the entire game, and his 46-point eruption is a memory that will echo through the halls of The Omni for years to come.
